title: Party Politics in America
description: The seventeenth edition of Party Politics in America continues the comprehensive and authoritative coverage of political parties for which it is known while expanding and updating the treatment of key related topics including interest groups and elections. Marjorie Hershey builds on the book’s three-pronged coverage of party organization, party in the electorate, and party in government and integrates contemporary examples―such as campaign finance reform, party polarization, and social media―to bring to life the fascinating story of how parties shape our political system. New to the 17th Edition
author: Marjorie Randon Hershey
